intro: Calonyction pseudomuricatum, commonly known as the false globe flower, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. Native to South America, particularly Argentina and Chile, it thrives in temperate climates. The plant is often grown in gardens for its ornamental value and delicate appearance. It prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight.
